title: release mode is optimizing away important functionality

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The crate enigo, which allows rust programs to type arbitrary unicode using the keyboard, has hit a snag: in `--release` mode it doesn't work

- enigo-rs/enigo#37

Even worse, I cannot find a way to disable release optimizations for just this crate, or the functions it provides.

Some questions:
- Is there a way to disable optimizations for a single function or even a whole crate? I have tried marking all functions as both `#[no_mangle]` and `#[inline(never)]`, but neither had any effect.
- Does anyone have a *guess* at what might be causing this? A lot of the functionality relies on calls to a C library -- is there some reason rust might be optimizing that away?

We are both pretty confused by the behavior.
